intro: Guettarda platypoda, commonly known as the flat-leaf guettarda, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptic to ovate in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
